intro: Pentacalia yanetharum, commonly known as the yellow pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Jamaica and Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pentacalia yanetharum is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
